title.rendered: Naveen Gupta Wiki, Age, Wife, Family, Biography & More

content.rendered:
Naveen Gupta is an Indian Business executive. He was appointed by Zoomcar as the Vice President and  Country Head for India on 28 November 2022.

Contents

  • Wiki/Biography
  • Physical Appearance
  • Family
  • Career
    • Internships
    • Hero MotoCorp
    • redBus
    • Swiggy
    • CARS24
    • Zoomcar
  • Awards & Achievements
  • Facts/Trivia

Wiki/Biography

Naveen Gupta did his schooling till 8th grade at the Convent of Jesus & Mary, Ambala Cantt., Haryana. In 2002, he completed his 10th grade at St. Anne’s Convent School, Chandigarh, and 12th grade at Govt. Model Senior Secondary School, Sector 33, Chandigarh. After completing his schooling at Chandigarh, Gupta pursued B.Tech in Electronics and Communications at Kurukshetra University, Kurukshetra, Haryana (2004-2008). In 2010, he completed his M.Sc in Marketing from the Nyenrode Business University, Netherlands, and also pursued the course in Marketing Channels & retailing and Market Intelligence & International Brand Management. In 2011, he received an MBA degree in International Business from the Indian Institute of Foreign Trade, New Delhi. 

Physical Appearance

Height (approx.): 5′ 8″

Hair Colour: Black

Eye Colour: Black

Family

There is not much information available about his family.

Career

Internships

Naveen Gupta joined Bharti Airtel Limited as an intern for two months (July 2006- August 2006), where he learnt the basic GSM network concepts and the Value added services. In 2007, he did an internship at Nokia Siemens Networks (July- August) and was selected as a best intern there. In 2010, he joined Percept Knorigin as an intern for three months (April- June).

Hero MotoCorp

Naveen Gupta worked at Hero MotoCorp Ltd, New Delhi for more than three years. He joined the firm in July 2011 as a Management Trainee. During his training, he did his Primary Market Research in 10 countries (4 S.E Asian, 3 Latin American, 3 Western African) and Secondary Market Research in 5 countries (3 Latin American, 2 African). He was promoted to Deputy Manager in June 2012 and pioneered Hero’s 1st International market launch post-split with Honda. In April 2013, Gupta was promoted from Deputy Manager to Country Sales Manager, and he was responsible for Sales & Distribution, Network Development, and Marketing for the Central American region, managing the business in Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, and Nicaragua.

redBus

In September 2014, he joined redBus (an online bus ticket booking platform) as a Manager of International Business Development in Bengaluru, India. In July 2015, he was promoted to Business Manager, where he was responsible for Business strategy, Unit Economics, Supply acquisition, Driving offline marketing, Affiliates, B2B Product Management, Operations, and Setting up teams & offices in Singapore & Malaysia. In October 2018, he was appointed as Associate Director of the firm.

Swiggy

Naveen Gupta worked at Swiggy for almost 3 years. He joined the firm in New Delhi in March 2019 as a City Head, where he was responsible for managing the Supply, Growth & Operations, and P&L of the firm in Delhi/NCR. In January 2021, he was appointed Business Director of the firm, having P&L responsibility for Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand.

CARS24

Gupta worked as a National Sales Head at CARS24 in Gurugram Haryana for more than one year.

Zoomcar

On 28 November 2022, Gupta was appointed as the Vice President and Country Head for India by Zoomcar (an Indian car-sharing platform). After appointing Naveen Gupta as the Country Head for India, the CEO and Co-Founder of Zoomcar, Greg Moran, said,

Naveen’s diverse skill sets and seasoned leadership will play an instrumental role in continuing to scale the India Business. I am confident that in his new role, he will help excellently position the company as we scale our marketplace pan-India.” [1]The Economic Times

Awards & Achievements

  • In March 2007, he won the third prize in National Level Project Presentation for presenting his Summer Intern project at Cognizance’07 (the second largest technical fest organized in India) under his B.Tech program.
  • In April 2008, he received a ‘Letter of Appreciation’ from the Asst. Director of M.M Engineering College (Kurukshetra University). He was among the Top 3 students from his batch and also brought six National awards to the college.
  • In September 2009, he received the ‘Order of Merit Award for Best work in promotional Marketing’ from the Marketing Association of America (MAA), USA.
  • In October 2010, he won second prize in International Collegiate Business Strategy Competition held at Dooxle International Pte Ltd, Singapore.
  • He is also a winner of ‘The National Level Social Campaign Design and Execution Contest’ held at IIM Indore in December 2010.

Facts/Trivia

  • Naveen Gupta loves travelling and has travelled to more than 50 countries.
  • He is a sports lover.
  • In his leisure time, he loves to practice salsa.
  • While pursuing an M. Sc. (Marketing) at Nyenrode Business University, Naveen Gupta formulated India’s entry strategy for a Dutch-based company (Metris B.V) under Company Sponsored Project for which he received a Letter of Appreciation from the International Marketing Manager.
  • While doing his MBA at IIFT in New Delhi, Naveen Gupta was the editor-in-chief of MarkMantra, the Marketing e-magazine of IIFT.

References[+][−]

References
↑1 The Economic Times
